explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_solids.rationale: Although there is information that it is inflammable (however, flame proofs), there is no data with defined test method.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Although there is information of flammable (however, flame retardant), no data based on a set test method.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen and chlorine (but not fluorine) and these elements are chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on rat LD50 value: 500 to 750 mg/kg (DFGOT vol.11, 1998), the lowest value was adopted and it was set as Category 4.

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on rat LD50 value: 1535mg/kg (RTECS, 2005) and >5000mg/kg (HSDB, 2005), the lowest value was adopted and it was set as Category 4.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as Category 2 from description that the skin is stimulated (ICSC (J) (1995), HSDB (2005), HSFS (2001), and SITTIG (4th, 2002)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: From description that the eye of the rat is stimulated strongly (DFGOT (vol.11, 1998) , and from description that the eye is stimulated (ICSC (J) (1995), HSDB (2005), HSFS (2001), and SITTIG (4th, 2002)), it was set as Category 2A .

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Classification not possible
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respirator: No data Skin : Although a possibility of putting it outside of the Category is considered from the description that any allergic nature was not identified in the guinea pigs of DFGOT (vol.11, 1998), it was judged that the test method was not clear enough and data was not sufficient enough to put it outside of the Category.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: The substance was regarded as outside the categories. Because of negative results from dominant lethal tests in rats and mice (DFGOT vol.11, 1998, IARC 41, 1986), chromosome aberration tests using hamster spermatogenic cells (DFGOT vol.11, 1998, IARC Suppl. 7 1986), and chromosome aberration tests and micronucleus tests using mouse bone-marrow cells (DFGOT vol.11, 1998).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Chlorophenoxy herbicides is classified into 2B according to IARC (41, 1987). But 2,4,5-T was classified into A4 according to ACGIH (7th, 2001). Therefore, it carried out the outside of category based on the segment of ACGIH which is the latest evaluation.

toxic_to_reproduction.hazard_statement: May damage fertility or the undorn child
toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: There are descriptions that the result which indicates teratogenicity or increase of abortions is not obtained in an epidemiological study (ACGIH (7th, 2001), DFGOT (vol.11, 1998), and IARC (45, 1998)). However, in the study using mouse and rat, there is a description that specific reproductive toxicity was observed with the dose which general toxicity is not observed in parental animals (DFGOT (vol.11, 1998)). Therefore, it was classified into Category 1B.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: It was set as Category 3 (respiratory tracts irritation) based on the description that the respiratory tracts are irritated ( ICSC (J) (1995), HSDB (2005), HSFS (2001), and SITTIG (4th, 2002)).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (skin) through prolonged or repeated exposure; May cause damage to organs (kidneys, immune system) through prolonged or repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It was classified to Category 1 as the skin is considered target organ because of the description that chloracne is found in the manufacturing workers of DFGOT (vol.11, 1998). Moreover, it was classified to Category 2 as kidney and immune systems are considered target organ because of the description that the renal effects and decrease of white corpuscles were acknowledged in guidance value Category 2 by the oral study using the rats of DFGOT (vol.11, 1998), and because of the description that lymphopenia was acknowledged in guidance value Category 2 by the oral study using the dogs of ACGIH (7th, 2001).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.98mg/L of fishes (Rainbow trout) (HSDB, 2004) .

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, supposed not rapidly degrading (BIOWIN), though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow=3.31(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
